intro: Vignea curvula, commonly known as the curly vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glories and other climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its spiral-shaped stems and small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its roots are fibrous and used in traditional medicine. Vignea curvula thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found growing along riverbanks and in humid woodlands.
